result.execSummary:
The defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Deshawn Bernard Brooks

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

COURT ORDERED Defendant to serve 90 DAYS, STRAIGHT TIME, in the House of Correction, to run concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served.  

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS:
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due on or before 09-22-2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Restitution of $1,206.00 to Milwaukee County up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due on or before 09-22-2017.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.

Received and filed with court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Defendant waived rights and pled GUILTY.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire received and filed.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Parties stipulate to the facts of the complaint as a basis for a guilty plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the complaint.  Judgment of Conviction entered. Parties are prepared to proceed with Sentencing.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Defendant not produced.  Case adjourned for plea/sentencing hearing.  Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Lindsey Grady, Branch 23 in Courthouse room 515.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 22, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT PRODUCED FROM DODGE FOR PURPOSES OF THE PROJECTED GUILTY PLEA HEARING IN BRANCH 45.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, Defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks not in court, in custody.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant not produced from Dodge for purposes of this hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for July 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  COURT WILL RETAIN FILE.

Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks not in court, in custody.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Statements by defense counsel that defendant has a pending case scheduled for projected guilty plea on 06-23-2015 before Branch 3.  Defense counsel requests a projected guilty plea date before branch 45 on same date. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 45.  Plea hearing scheduled for June 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Michael Jude for Stephen Andrew Sargent in court, defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks not in court, in custody.  Catelin Ringersma appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defense requests a plea/sentencing date. Case adjourned to Branch 46.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks in court with attorney Douglas J. Rebholz.  Defendant Deshawn Bernard Brooks in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Reserve Branch 46.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
